Our monthly employee newsletter with company updates and announcements -----
September 2021 Edition

Welcome to the Latest Edition of 
The Justia Insider

Welcome to the latest issue of the Justia Insider. We are excited to kick off the month with new projects and goals. The company’s success rests on the shoulders of all of the teams. September is a great month to get started on any plans that you put off. Do not miss the opportunity for a fresh start; squeeze every second out of your day to achieve your goals.

Milestones & Accomplishments

Let’s Find Out What’s Been Achieved So Far by Our Teams at Justia

Justia Properties Mass Update: We keep standardizing and promoting our products throughout all Justia web properties. We updated the header and footer on all of our public sites. We also published a campaign to boost JLD profile claims.

Marketing Blasts: We continue marketing Justia Amplify to all of our existing website and blog clients via email, as well as our JLD claimed lawyers. We are running this effort in addition to our regular monthly scheduled campaigns.

Automated QA: As accustomed, our QA Automation Team continues delivering automated verifications to our properties. This month's releases include the first version for Hazel (Elevate), Bar Data imports integrity, Dockets verifications, and general fixes.

IT Maintenance: We upgraded the hosting infrastructure of some of our Oyez projects such as Body Politic, Shifting Scales, and pocketjustice.com to keep them current and secure.

U.S. State Regulations: This month, we finally released the latest quarterly update of all U.S. state regulations.

Social Media Icons Update: We updated the selection of social media icons on our websites and blogs with new versions following brand colors and guidelines from major social networks. We also added a few new options to use in Elevate sites.

JUSTIA PORTAL NEWS

Take a Look at the Ongoing Development of Our Consumer Portal
  • Cannabis Law Center: We have created content for a brand new center to guide business owners, employees, and investors in the marijuana industry.
  • Sports Law Center Expansion: We have added an overview and a 50-state survey on the image rights of student-athletes, a significant development in college sports.
  • Divorce Center Updates: Our team has completed revisions and additions that account for changes in divorce law and provide more detail on their nuances.
  • Medical Malpractice Center New Look: Our team has added boxes highlighting key points on these pages, making a complex area of law more accessible.
  • Justia Mexico Portal Updates: We added new content pages to the Civil Law Center. These pages cover Civil Associations, Condominiums, Mortgages, Real Estate Lease Agreements, and Real Estate Purchase and Sale Agreements.

NEW TEAM MEMBERS

Getting to Know the New Talent at Justia

Nina McKee

Web Marketing Associate

Hi everyone, my name is Nina McKee. I'm 22 and from the San Francisco Bay Area. I recently just graduated from SJSU with a degree in Psychology and Justice Studies. I've worked in marketing and data collection in both the private and nonprofit sectors. I love

to paint and draw in my free time, and I love to be in nature when I can. I look forward to working with you all.

UPCOMING HOLIDAYS

Dates to Remember
Mexico’s Independence Day - September 16th

Mexico’s Independence Day has turned into a nationwide celebration over the past 200-plus years. September 16th, 1810 is the date when Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla, a Catholic priest known as Father Hidalgo, made the first cry for independence.

TEAM ACTIVITY

Virtual Painting Class

Justia hosted its first virtual painting class. All team members and their children participated in this fantastic activity. For about two hours, the participants displayed their artistic talents and skills using canvas and their acrylic paint set. Thank you to all who attended.

REVIEWS & RECOMMENDATIONS

Money, Explained

Available on Netflix

"The pandemic affects society’s physical and mental health. Unfortunately, it also increases other types of stress (for example, financial stress). Due to the increase of online scams, it is important to be wary and protect ourselves and avoid situations that could take a toll on us. Money, Explained is a Netflix documentary series that educates people on money and warns people about scams. The documentary is easy to follow, with simple language and graphics. My favorite episode is the second one about credit cards."
- Hector Lugo

Collaborators: Miguel Berlanga, Donovan Coronado, Haydee Garcia, Alejandra Medina, Alejandro Moreno, Lauren Moskie, Rene Peralta, and Jose Ramos
